attributes.action: Reinstate George Osborne's plan to set up a 2nd hand annuity market
attributes.background: People have been waiting nearly two years to be able to sell their poor monthly payments for cash lump sums where they can make a difference to their lives.   For example, I've sat with no working boiler as I can't afford one without my annuity funds in one payment.

attributes.action: Full pension rights for people thrown out  of the navy for living with ts person
attributes.background: Living with ts person was illegal back in 82, I was kicked out for this crime but I was 21 at the time and doing nothing wrong under cival law, now a days you get to stay in if you fall in love with a ts.I find it repugnent not to eben have had a simple sorry from the powers that be.

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd for denying visa to bone marrow donor.
attributes.background: May Brown, 23, from Dorset, who has leukaemia, has been told that her Nigerian sister Martha is a "10 out of 10" tissue match.  However, the Home Office denied a visa because "all visa applications must be assessed against the immigration rules".
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-dorset-37656377

attributes.action: Increase the number of specialist road traffic officers to reduce road deaths
attributes.background: 10,732 people died on UK roads between 2010 and 2015. In the period Jan to March 2016 alone saw a 14% increase in reported road deaths. Without the fear of detection, non-compliance of road safety rules and laws is noticeably increasing. Enforcement is no longer supporting education or engineering
attributes.additional_details:
"The level of enforcement on our roads is woefully inadequate, 
between 2010 and 2014 the UK has seen a 27% reduction in the number of specialist road traffic police on the roads (falling from 5,338 to 3,901) outside of London". Brake-the road safety charity
Without a visible police presence, road users no longer fear being caught and are increasing non-compliant and yet detection rates are falling
Between 2010-15 133,565 people were seriously injured
Motor insurers paid out Â£27m per day in 2015

attributes.action: To change the laws on criminals being prosecuted on the account of rape.
attributes.background: This petition is to change the minimum jail sentence length and to rule out community service as a legitimate charge. Victims dealing with cases such as this deserve to be able to go about their lives as they wish, without having the fear of running into their offenders.
attributes.additional_details: Personally, I don't think that community service is an appropriate sentence for someone being convicted of rape. The victims and their families would have been put through hell and the perpetrator receiving community service for however long is basically letting them get away with it, when the victims deserve a lot more justice for the crime that was committed.

attributes.action: Stop advancement of religion being considered a charitable purpose.
attributes.background: The law recognises the advancement of religion as a charitable purpose. Religion includes all faiths and none  it includes a religion that does not have a belief in God. Advancing any belief system alone should not be considered charitable activity.
attributes.additional_details: Some belief systems may help people but assessing whether the beliefs themselves achieve benefit is subjective.  Public money through gift aid should not be available for this. Religious organisations should have to show other public benefit to qualify as charity and should only be allowed to use public money for that other purpose.

attributes.action: Make it law to carry a breakdown warning triangle in every motor vehicle.
attributes.background: If a warning triangle is displayed 100 metres behind a broken down vehicle, it will decrease the chances of someone else crashing into it. What if you had broken down somewhere awkward like a roundabout or a bridge without a hard shoulder?
attributes.additional_details:
It is already mandatory in France to carry a warning triangle.

It alerts other road users to a breakdown so they have enough time to react.

It is very effective on motorways where there is no hard shoulder.

It is known to reduce the amount of accidents involving broken down vehicles.

attributes.action: Publish all registered sex offenders names, addresses and nature of crime.
attributes.background: America allows all law enforcement to publish to the public the names, addresses and crimes committed by all sex offenders.  we as the UK public should be able to have this information to keep our kids safe.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megan%27s_Law Link to background info on Megan's law this has been running successfully for many years and is proof that it works! The united kingdom public should be informed in order to protect our children if we don't know where they are how can we protect our vulnerable members of society.

attributes.action: Abolish psychiatric electroconvulsive therapy â ECT - electroshock to the brain
attributes.background: ECT causes brain cell death, brain bleed and swelling. It can cause permanent memory loss, cognitive impairment and even death. It can trigger suicide. ECT machines have never been independently inspected or approved for medical safety, not even by the regulators for the UK - MHRA or the US â FDA.
attributes.additional_details: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is a psychiatric procedure where up to 400 volts is put through the brain for up to 8 seconds causing an epileptic fit purportedly to relieve mental distress.   Mainly given to women and the elderly, sometimes to children and often without consent.  Patients are rarely fully informed about the potential harm.  Dr Peter Breggin states ECT produces a âclosed head injury highâ www.ectresources.org. Abolish ECT. www.speakoutagainstpsychiatry.org

attributes.action: Change to Western European time to take advantage of 1hr extra evening daylight
attributes.background: Conversion to Western European time would give one hour additional evening daylight throughout the year. Western France, much of Spain and all of Portugal are to the west of the UK and yet they are 1hr ahead. It would also have a business advantage of harmonising UK time with Western Europe.

attributes.action: Seek a UN treaty on mutual recognition and enforcement of telephone privacy laws
attributes.background: Despite using the TPS, I have been bombarded with spam telephone calls from India and some other foreign countries. Many of these calls are barely disguised scams. Within the EU there is mutual recognition of such schemes and it works well. This should be extended by treaty to all nations in the ITU
attributes.additional_details:
TPS = Telephone Preference Service
ITU = International Telecommunications Union, a UN agency

To understand what gave me this idea, see: https://www.quora.com/What-is-the-creepiest-phone-call-or-voice-message-youve-ever-received/answer/Peter-Charlot and my (Charles Stuart) comment.

Ofcom recognizes that people outside the EU are beyond their control. I would like a treaty to address this and set up mandatory reciprocal recognition of cold calling laws among ITU member states.

attributes.action: Reduce the working day to 6 hours with the same salary.
attributes.background:
Companies in Sweden have reduced the working hours of their employees to six hours, reporting happier staff, a lower turnover rate, and an increase in profits in that time.

Who doesn't want to spend more time with their friends and family, whilst also being more motivated and productive at work?
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/sweden-introduces-six-hour-work-day-a6674646.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/the-six-hour-work-day-increases-productivity-so-will-britain-and-america-adopt-one-sweden-a7066961.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-34677949

attributes.action: Drug test all ministers and senior civil servants including the military
attributes.background: Rig workers are tested to avoid destroying the North Sea in fact lots of employers demand a pre employment tests. Our representatives are running the country and far too many senior politicians behave and look like they are on much more than fairy dust .We deserve the best.

attributes.action: Give British people a say in our post-referendum relationship with the EU
attributes.background: The EU referendum gave the option of leaving or remaining in the EU. The options in reality are more nuanced and there is a risk of the British populace getting an unsatisfactory outcome. Given the lies of the pre-referendum campaigning we need honesty about the future of Britain and further say.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to know, and have a say on:
Whether further austerity measures might be necessary after leaving the EU: www.just-fair.co.uk/#!United-Nations-Austerity-policies-breach-the-UK%E2%80%99s-international-human-rights-obligations/qbw0c/577384fa0cf231749dc9f955
How immigration will be affected www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37271420
Whether the NHS will be better off by Â£350 million per week
Whether the United Kingdom will split up
How our successful science base will be protected

attributes.action: Prevent closure of Path House Mental Health Crisis Service in Ludlow.
attributes.background: The fundamental benefit of Path House is to offer guests a homely but therapeutic alternative to hospital admission as this is financially very costly and often vastly unnecessary or inappropriate for the individual; preferring a less extreme route to recovery.
attributes.additional_details: Shropshire CCG say that Path House would be better suited to a location in either Shrewsbury or North Shropshire as it is "under-occupied". It's our belief that Path's location in Ludlow is what makes it such a special and unique service, the town provides peace and calm and for the majority of our guests that come from larger towns; Ludlow offers the anonymity that guests largely benefit from. The location is only undesirable from the point of view of the CCG in terms of traveling the A49 for reviews and transporting guests. From our point of view and that of the guest; the location is what aids and improves recovery so that guests can return home sooner than they ordinarily would be able to.

attributes.action: Make Taxi Drivers require a black box
attributes.background: As a young driver, I myself have a black box and am personally limited to the speed I can travel at.Taxi drivers have the privilege to be able to drive in bus lanes and I am always seeing them driving past the speed limit. This is dangerous for everyone and increases the likelihood of an accident
attributes.additional_details: Once I was driving home travelling at 40mph in a 40 zone, and a taxi overtook me and came really close to hitting my car. The taxi driver was dropping off a customer on my road, and I confronted the taxi driver and asked why he was driving so close to my car and he said "because you were driving too slow". I told him that I had a black box and he said he understood, but then proceeded to tell me that in future I should let other people know that I have a black box by "using my hazard lights".

attributes.action: Make St. David's day (March 1st) a public holiday in Wales
attributes.background: I believe that St. David's day should be a public holiday for the Welsh. This was declined by Tony Blair in the past even though a majority (87%!) Wanted the change.

attributes.action: Defend a child's right to equality of education for 2year olds
attributes.background:
Petition for equal rights for ALL children's education, regardless of financial background.

A 2year old can now start education in public schools, government funded. But only qualify if the family receives benefits.

Working families are asked to pay for this service.
attributes.additional_details:
How is this fair that children from working class backgrounds are suffering and missing on education because of funding. I simply cannot afford this service because I work. This needs to change. My child is missing out on education because I chose to provide for my family morally.

Petition for equal rights for ALL children regardless of families financial background.

attributes.action: Make the BBC a Pay per view Channel and abolish the TV licence.
attributes.background: Why should we be obliged to pay a TV licence for the BBC when they abuse the money of it. If it is to watch all channels than the BBC should give a part to all of them! Make the BBC a pay per view channel and let people decide either or not they want to watch this channel and abolish the TV licence

attributes.action: Require visas for visitors to the UK & add a fee if they've no health insurance.
attributes.background: The fees raised for the visas should be used to off set the cost to the NHS for providing treatment to the visitors.

attributes.action: Urge the government to extend Help to Buy to include old properties.
attributes.background: The Government has dragged it's heels dealing with the housing crisis in London so as a result we need to urge them to do more regarding affordable housing. One of the things the government can and should do is extend the Help to Buy scheme to include older properties.
attributes.additional_details: The help to buy scheme could be really useful if it were extended to include older properties. The government should also charge a percentage identical to the bank of England base rate after the 5yr free period. If the UK government is serious about helping Londoners get on the ladder they should revise the Help to Buy scheme immediately to include older properties as house builders have pushed up the cost of new builds at an alarming rate. Not everyone wants a new build.

attributes.action: Delay Article 50 until impact of Brexit is clear, then consult the people again.
attributes.background: The question oversimplified the issue and was open to interpretation. The Government took the result as a mandate to exit at any cost. A "hard Brexit" will damage the economy and may break up the UK. The result was too close to justify this. Opinion polls suggest a different result if run today.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent ITV poll suggests that 12% of people would change their vote if the referendum was run again. This exceeds the margin of the Leave result in the Referendum
http://www.itv.com/news/update/2017-02-17/how-do-you-feel-about-brexit-vote-now/

attributes.action: Make 'name blind' recruitment a legal requirement
attributes.background:
The Equality Act 2010 made discrimination based on race, religion, gender, disability and sexual orientation illegal. 

Yet employers routinely discriminate against those with a foriegn sounding name on their cvs despite them having identical qualifications to other candidates. This must end now.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent BBC report stated that candidates with an âEnglish-sounding nameâ could be offered three times the number of interviews than an applicant with a Muslim name with the same qualifications.

Similarly, those with African or Caribbean sounding names are equally discriminated against as are women:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/38751307?client=ms-android-orange-gb. 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/34636464?client=ms-android-orange-gb.

This creates an unequal society for UK citizens.

attributes.action: Control and Determine the Terms and Timing of any Second Independence Referendum
attributes.background: Should the Scottish Parliament vote to hold another Independence Referendum, the UK Government should honour it, but control the terms and timings of IndyRef2. Specifically, it should take place well after Brexit, rather than before or during, so voters can first assess its effects to Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: The Scottish Government stated the 2014 Referendum was a "Once in a Generation" vote; their own White Paper stated a UK-wide EU referendum was a possibility if Scots voted "No". Despite a policy pledge to pursue another referendum if the UK voted to leave the EU and Scotland voted to remain, the SNP did not win an overall majority in the May Holyrood Elections.  The Green Party made no similar policy stipulation. Therefore, it is contended no mandate exists for the terms and timings of IndyRef2.

attributes.action: Demand a stop to potential closure of Glenfield children's heart unit
attributes.background: The children's heart unit at Glenfield Hospital is being threatened with closure. If this is carried out, what would it mean for some children? How might they cope in a situation of having no hospital near them to go to in an emergency?

attributes.action: Ban gambling and live odds advertising during sports broadcasts.
attributes.background: With the explosion of the Premier League, a similar and more sinister growth has taken place, that of online gambling. A gambling addiction can ruin families and lives and with smartphones accessible 24/7, it has never been easier to gamble.
attributes.additional_details: The government has banned smoking adverts yet betting companies are still allowed to advertise, with a 600% increase from 2006-2012 and children as young as 4 being exposed to 200 adverts a year. This creates a sense that gambling is part of life and everybody is doing it whereas in reality it can become dangerous. We are not asking for a ban on gambling, all we want is to separate the enjoyment of sport from the dangers of gambling, by banning gambling adverts during the broadcast of sport.

attributes.action: Stop nurseries charging fees when children are sick or on holiday.
attributes.background: Many nurseries charge 100% fees when a child does not attend due to sickness or holiday. They even sell the session to other parents, doubling their profit. This expense can put some parents off returning to work and make family holidays less affordable.

attributes.action: Ban the importation and distribution of all dyed fish.
attributes.background: Dyeing fish is completely unatural and inhumane. Fish that have been injected with these dyes suffer a dramatically shortened life span and are much more susceptible to infection and disease. It is said that in most cases only 50% of fish actually survive the procedure.
attributes.additional_details: Reference - http://www.pets4homes.co.uk/pet-advice/the-phenomenon-of-dyed-fish-and-how-to-avoid-it.html

attributes.action: Reduce the UK's foreign aid budget from 0.7% GDP to 0.1% GDP.
attributes.background: Increase Social Care Funding by reducing the UK's foreign aid budget from 0.7% GDP Â£12 Billion Pounds to 0.1% GDP Â£1.714  Billion Pounds. The remaining 0.6% of GDP Â£10.285 Billion Pounds could then be used to increase funding for Social Care and improve the quality of life of British Citizens.

attributes.action: Fine neglectful parents who send there children to school when child is unwell.
attributes.background: Change the law and fine parents that send there child to school when the child is unwell or ill. Not meeting the child's needs is classed as neglect. Children will not learn when they feel poorly and they spread germs to other healthy children.
attributes.additional_details:
Neglect
In this type of child maltreatment there is a failure to provide for a child's basic physical or emotional needs, which is likely to damage the child's health or development.
Not helping a child to have the medical care or treatment that they need. This includes having their normal routine immunisations and attending hospital appointments. It also includes not giving them medication which has been prescribed.

Copy from in part.  http://patient.info/health/safeguarding-children

attributes.action: Create fair & honest revenue stream for NHS & social care with hypothecated tax
attributes.background: It's time UK govt & people had a grown-up relationship with NHS and social care funding. Replace NI contributions with a stand alone tax to fund NHS & social care. The people would then see the true costs and politicians could say how much or how little they were willing to raise in their manifesto
attributes.additional_details: Obviously not all tax revenue comes from people's income. There would still be a proportion coming from Corporation, Value Added and other tax raising streams. However these proportions could be protected so the percentage of burden on the population's income always remains the same.

attributes.action: Support Community Radio/Media organisations with a substantive funding increase.
attributes.background: There are now over 240 Ofcom licensed Community Radio/Media organisations across the UK, many of whom are struggling and increasingly having to commercialise their operations to survive, against the spirit and original intent of Community Radio since inception in 2002/04. http://tiny.cc/comradiofund
attributes.additional_details: In addition to a substantive funding increase, a relaxation in the associated constraints on Community Radio Fund grant use (ie. what it can and cannot be spent on) is also sought. http://tiny.cc/comradiofund

attributes.action: End the discriminatory frozen overseas UK state pension policy in many countries
attributes.background: British pensioners who retire to over 120 countries, mainly Commonwealth, have their rightful state pension frozen impacting lives of 550,000 yet those retiring to other countries have their pension uprated annually, just as though they never left UK. This is discriminatory and causes huge anguish.
attributes.additional_details: More than 95% of the âfrozenâ pensioners live in Commonwealth countries.The National Insurance Fund is built up from member contributions, including contributions from those who are now frozen! It would cost less than 1% of the annual pension bill to unfreeze pensions. Pensions frozen Australia, Canada, New Zealand, most Commonwealth Countries, and many others. A reciprocal agreement is not needed before they can unfreeze frozen pensions, a simple stroke of the pen could do it.

attributes.action: Keep dove house in bushy fields hospital open and support mental health
attributes.background: Bushy fields hospitals dove house is used as a drop in centre for people suffering with mental health conditions

attributes.action: For Brexit Success: Abolish Business Rates and Make Up The Difference in VAT.
attributes.background: UK Businesses are grossly overcharged in business rates without bearing on the revenue they generate. Almost 4% of UK GDP is from these rates, verses 0.65% in the rest of Europe. UK businesses have to charge more to compensate, making them less competitive. Move to VAT would level the playing field.
attributes.additional_details:
[1]http://moneyweek.com/its-time-to-abolish-business-rates/
[2]https://www.retail-week.com/topics/policy-and-legal/uk-has-the-highest-business-rates-bill-across-eu-says-report/5049347.article
[3]http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/11912104/George-Osborne-unveils-radical-business-rates-overhaul.html
[4]http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/retailandconsumer/11815278/Business-tsar-backs-plea-for-business-rates-cut.html
For a small change in VAT the burden is removed from British Business.

attributes.action: I want a BAN on any child under 10 being allowed their ears pieced.
attributes.background: So by law if you were to put holes in another human beings body without permission then you'd be arrested for bodily harm, but parents believe they have the right to be doing this to babies and children, why can't a child have the right to ask for it to be done and choose to ruin their own bodies.
attributes.additional_details: A child starts hitting puberty around 10 which is when there body starts forming and it wouldn't make too much difference in piercing their ears. They'd be less likely to quickly move or cause damage or infection and you'd know there allergies (I.e Gold) by then, a child should be able to ask, especially as if they choose they don't like them they'll be left with either holes or scars on their ears all because there parents pierced them without permission while so young. It's assault.

attributes.action: Enforce the Consumer Rights Act to protect music, arts and sport fans from touts
attributes.background: Fans are being ripped-off by ticket resales. The Consumer Rights Act has not changed this. We demand that Parliament enact last yearâs ticket resale amendment, which provides tougher sanctions for resale websites, and also require ticket resellers to reveal their identities.

attributes.action: Ban Employment Agencies
attributes.background:
Employment Agencies exploit workers by acting as middle men to real jobs, they take cuts from already terrible wages, and have ruined chances for secure employment for British Nationals.

This drives down the UK living standards, work life balance, and makes it tougher to get real employment.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies that employ staff also exploit Employment Agencies as they pay agencies less money than they would pay their staff to get work done. Companies don't have to employ agency workers as staff, even when the workers do a fantastic job.

Some agency workers even come from different countries, and are happy to work for pittance as their foreign value of money is less than ours in the UK.

This is extremely unfair and unethical for for British Nationals in their own country.

attributes.action: Make the Law Society the only regulatory body for Solicitors
attributes.background: The SRA and the Law Society coexist but the Law Society traditionally are the body that was formed on the 2 June 1825 that regulated solicitors up until the formation of the SRA in 2007. The SRA offer nothing different from the Law Society and are just an added expense to solicitors and taxpayers.

attributes.action: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror.
attributes.background: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror threats promptly with no waiting time for specialist units to attend the scene. Increase the fitness standard of all police officers and provide all officers firearms training. Only equip officers that meet the standard.

attributes.action: Permanently seize any vehicle used by a drink/drug driver following a conviction
attributes.background: Once a person is convicted of drink/drug driving they keep the vehicle that was used during the commission of the offence. This could be following a 12 - 24 month ban passed by a court. The vehicle will usually remain outside the home address of the person convicted, until temptation to use it hits.

attributes.action: Theresa May MUST make statement to Parliament if Trump visit Petition rejected.
attributes.background: If Theresa May rejects the Petition to ban Trump on the grounds of "It would "undo everything" achieved in talks with Donald Trump" she MUST make a statement to Parliament to explain EXACTLY what she achieved on her visit to the US and why banning Trump would put that at risk.

attributes.action: Make Enhanced DBS Checks a Legal Requirement for all MPs.
attributes.background: As a Health Professional I was surprised to learn that MPs, unlike other Public Servants in a position of trust, are not routinely required to have an Enhanced DBS check as a condition of their employment. MPs should be honest, trustworthy and above reproach, so background checks are reasonable.
attributes.additional_details:
I looked into background checks because the recent "Brexit" referendum raised doubts about the professional ethics and integrity of some of the MPs involved.

In 2014 North East MP Helen Goodman called for MPs to have "the same sort of checks as teachers and youth workers." As far as I'm aware this hasn't happened yet and is long overdue.

http://www.thejournal.co.uk/news/north-east-news/criminal-checks-needed-make-sure-7386465

attributes.action: Core travel infrastructure should seek ACAS approval prior to strike action
attributes.background: 2016 has seen various industrial strike actions due various industrial disputes. The Government should appoint an independent body i.e. ACAS (Advisory, Conciliation & Arbitration Service) to mediate between core travel businesses and Unions to ensure that any strike action is avoided where possible.
attributes.additional_details:
2016 saw an increase in strike action a total of 269,000 days lost due to industrial action since October 2016. This is over a 50% increase to the figures of 2015 which is 169,000 days lost due to industrial action (figures from Office for National Statistics)
Core travel infrastructure industrial actions needs to assure that Unions voices are heard with assurance that their request to strike are reasonable & limited. Strike action causes increased travel time and costs to thousands of commuters

attributes.action: Give a higher bursary to areas that are more deprived.
attributes.background: For some students Â£60/Â£100 over 12 weeks to cover travelling cost and lunch, is simply not enough.
attributes.additional_details: New schools are funded for bursaries on the assumption that 36% of students will be eligible, this is the national average. A higher level of deprivation area such as Newham will have a higher percentage that will need support whereas a Sixth from/College/Universities in an affluent area will have hardly any that need support. So, therefore, educational facilities in deprived areas must spread a small amount amongst many students, while educational institutions in affluent areas have more money than they need, which is not fair they should fund based on local needs, not the national average and in special cases fund specific students a lot more.

attributes.action: Allow all Mains Post Offices in the UK to be able to issue passport forms.
attributes.background: Many main Post Offices are being asked for Passport forms on a daily basis. We undertake every other aspect of travel : insurance, currency, travel money cards and credit cards. Why do we have to send customers to competitors when we could issue and check and send passports?
attributes.additional_details: We want a level playing field for all main Post Offices who would all offer this essential service.

attributes.action: Return to the previous method of calculating Child Maintenance Payments.
attributes.background: The new Child Maintenance Service takes an estranged parents income direct from HMRC records.  This means that this now includes "income" listed on the HMRC listing that may be for benefit in kind taxation purposes and not be cash in a parents bank which is grossly unfair.
attributes.additional_details: Rt Hon Damien Green needs to order a review of the changes to return to the old method of calculating CSA payments from net income which is the only disposable income an estranged parent has control over.

attributes.action: Stop DWP removing Motability cars before the Appeal Process is exhausted.
attributes.background: Motability car drivers are disadvantaged when PIP assessments mean they can no longer keep their cars.
attributes.additional_details:
Personal Independence Payment (PIP) assessment means disabled people are quite often assessed at the standard rate for mobility. This means they are no longer entitled to a Motability vehicle. The letter informing them of this gives them four weeks to return their cars. 

If their reconsideration and/or appeal is successful, they will have given up their cars for nothing. 

Please find a way to help these people keep their cars until a final appeal is unsuccessful.

attributes.action: Populate the Isle of Wight with Deer
attributes.background: Currently there are only a handful of deer on the Isle of Wight due to everytime any are spotted they are exterminated but I think that having deer on the island if controlled satisfactorily would be a good asset for the island.

attributes.action: 2 p should be put on income tax solely for the purpose of funding NHS resources
attributes.background: Background??? - look around - ask people - take a (cynical) look at the news - ask your GP - ask the next person you see in a wheelchair - visit any oncology unit - If nothing's done a lot of people will die a cold, lonely, painful, hideous death
